# orientationDidChangeNotification

**Type Property**

A notification that posts when the orientation of the device changes.

## Declaration

```swift
nonisolated class let orientationDidChangeNotification: NSNotification.Name
```

## Discussion

You can obtain the new orientation by getting the value of the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDevice/orientation] property.

## Managing notifications

- **batteryLevelDidChangeNotification**: A notification that posts when the battery level changes.
- **batteryStateDidChangeNotification**: A notification that posts when battery state changes.
- **proximityStateDidChangeNotification**: A notification that posts when the state of the proximity sensor changes.
